Achieve your fitness goals from the comfort of your home with our comprehensive workout routines and expert guidance. Whether you are a beginner or a seasoned fitness enthusiast, our app offers tailored workouts designed to challenge and inspire you.
Start in the regular push-up position, then let your knees touch the floor and raise your feet up off the floor. Next, push your body up and down.
Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, then put your hands on the ground and kick your feet backward. Do a quick push-up and then jump up.
Stretching exercises involve slowly moving your body into different positions to lengthen and elongate muscles, promoting flexibility and range of motion.
Stand with your feet shoulder width apart and your hands on your hips.
Step a big step backward with your right leg and lower your body until your left thigh is parallel to the floor. Return and repeat with the other side.
Lie on your left side with your head resting on your left hand.
Then lift your right leg and repeat it.
Stand with your feet shoulder width apart and your arms stretched forward, then lower your body until your thighs are parallel with the floor.
Your Knees should be extended in the same direction as your toes. Return to the start position and do the next rep.
This works the thighs, hips buttocks, quads, hamstrings and lower body.
Start on all fours with your knees under your butt and your hands under your shoulders.
Then lift your left leg and squeeze your butt as much as you can. Go back to the start position and report the exercise.
Start in the squat position, then jump up using your abdominal muscles for strength. This exercise works your abdomen.
Lie on your back with your knees bent and your arms stretched forward.
Then Lift your upper body off the floor. Hold for a few seconds and slowly return.
It primarily works the rectus adbominis muscle and the obliques.
Start in the regular push-up position but with your hands elevated on a chair or bench.
Then push your body up down using your arm strength.
Remember to keep your body straight.
Start with your feet together and your arms by your sides, then jump up with your feet apart and your hands overhead.
Return to the start position then do the next rep. This exercise provides a full-body workout and works all your muscle groups.
